001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.regimes;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Proxy;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
005import net.tvburger.jdl.model.DataSet;
006import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.ObjectiveFunction;
007import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.Optimizer;
008import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.Regime;
009import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.TrainableFunction;
010
011import java.util.*;
012import java.util.function.Predicate;
013
014/**
015 * Composes and executes a chain of {@link Regime} decorators.
016 *
017 * <p>The chain stores regimes in order and, when trained, delegates to the
018 * <em>top</em> (last) regime. If the chain is empty, this class will invoke
019 * the provided {@link Optimizer} directly on the full {@link DataSet} as a
020 * single batch (a safe no-op fallback if the caller omitted regimes).</p>
021 *
022 * <h3>Semantics</h3>
023 * <ul>
024 *   <li><strong>Top regime:</strong> the last element in {@code chainedRegimes} receives
025 *       the {@link #train} call and typically wraps the rest.</li>
026 *   <li><strong>Lookup:</strong> {@link #getRegime(Class)} and {@link #findRegime(java.util.function.Predicate)}
027 *       return the first matching regime for introspection or reconfiguration.</li>
028 *   <li><strong>Iteration:</strong> Implements {@link Iterable} to expose the chain order (top to bottom).</li>
029 * </ul>
030 */
031@Strategy(Strategy.Role.CONCRETE)
032public class ChainedRegime implements Regime, Iterable<Regime> {
033
034    /**
035     * The ordered chain of regimes; the last element is the top/outermost decorator.
036     */
037    protected final List<Regime> chainedRegimes;
038
039    /**
040     * Creates a new chain.
041     *
042     * @param chainedRegimes ordered regimes; the last is considered the "top".
043     *                       May be empty; in that case {@link #train} falls back
044     *                       to direct optimizer invocation if provided.
045     */
046    protected ChainedRegime(List<Regime> chainedRegimes) {
047        this.chainedRegimes = chainedRegimes;
048    }
049
050    /**
051     * Trains by delegating to the topmost regime in the chain. If the chain is empty,
052     * invokes the {@link Optimizer} directly (if non-null) on the full dataset.
053     *
054     * @param estimationFunction the model to train
055     * @param trainingSet        the dataset to train on
056     * @param objective          the objective (loss) function
057     * @param optimizer          the optimizer to apply updates (used directly if chain is empty)
058     * @param <E>                the type of estimation function
059     */
060    @Override
061    public <E extends TrainableFunction<N>, N extends Number> void train(E estimationFunction, DataSet<N> trainingSet, ObjectiveFunction<N> objective, Optimizer<? super E, N> optimizer) {
062        train(estimationFunction, trainingSet, objective, optimizer, (Integer) null);
063    }
064
065    public <E extends TrainableFunction<N>, N extends Number> void train(E estimationFunction, DataSet<N> trainingSet, ObjectiveFunction<N> objective, Optimizer<? super E, N> optimizer, int step) {
066        train(estimationFunction, trainingSet, objective, optimizer, (Integer) step);
067    }
068
069    private <E extends TrainableFunction<N>, N extends Number> void train(E estimationFunction, DataSet<N> trainingSet, ObjectiveFunction<N> objective, Optimizer<? super E, N> optimizer, Integer step) {
070        if (chainedRegimes.isEmpty()) {
071            if (optimizer != null) {
072                if (step == null) {
073                    throw new IllegalStateException("No step specified, can't call optimizer!");
074                } else {
075                    optimizer.optimize(estimationFunction, trainingSet, objective, step);
076                }
077            }
078        } else {
079            if (step == null) {
080                chainedRegimes.getLast().train(estimationFunction, trainingSet, objective, optimizer);
081            } else {
082                chainedRegimes.getLast().train(estimationFunction, trainingSet, objective, optimizer, step);
083            }
084        }
085    }
086
087    /**
088     * Returns an iterator over the regimes in from top to bottom.
089     */
090    @Override
091    public Iterator<Regime> iterator() {
092        return chainedRegimes.reversed().iterator();
093    }
094
095    /**
096     * Returns the first regime assignable to {@code regimeTypeClass}, or throws if none.
097     *
098     * @param regimeTypeClass the desired regime type
099     * @param <R>             type parameter of the regime
100     * @return the first matching regime
101     * @throws java.util.NoSuchElementException if none found
102     */
103    public <R extends Regime> R asRegime(Class<R> regimeTypeClass) {
104        return getRegime(regimeTypeClass).orElseThrow();
105    }
106
107    /**
108     * Returns the first regime assignable to the requested type, if any.
109     *
110     * @param regimeTypeClass the desired regime type
111     * @param <R>             type parameter of the regime
112     * @return an {@link Optional} containing the first match, or empty
113     */
114    public <R extends Regime> Optional<R> getRegime(Class<R> regimeTypeClass) {
115        for (Regime regime : chainedRegimes) {
116            if (regimeTypeClass.isInstance(regime)) {
117                return Optional.of(regimeTypeClass.cast(regime));
118            }
119        }
120        return Optional.empty();
121    }
122
123    /**
124     * Returns the first regime matching the predicate, if any.
125     *
126     * @param predicate match condition
127     * @return an {@link Optional} containing the first match, or empty
128     */
129    public Optional<Regime> findRegime(Predicate<? super Regime> predicate) {
130        for (Regime regime : chainedRegimes) {
131            if (predicate.test(regime)) return Optional.of(regime);
132        }
133        return Optional.empty();
134    }
135
136    /**
137     * {@inheritDoc}
138     */
139    @Override
140    public String toString() {
141        return "ChainedRegime" + chainedRegimes;
142    }
143
144    /**
145     * A lightweight link that forwards {@link Regime#train} to another regime in the chain
146     * by index (supports negative indexes counted from the end).
147     *
148     * <p>Used internally by builders to target the current top or relative positions
149     * while the chain is being assembled.</p>
150     *
151     * @param chainedRegimes    Reference to the chained regimes
152     * @param linkedRegimeIndex The target index; negative values are relative to the end.
153     */
154    @Proxy
155    private record Link(List<Regime> chainedRegimes, int linkedRegimeIndex) implements Regime {
156
157        /**
158         * Resolves the linked regime by index (handling negative indexes).
159         *
160         * @return the target regime or {@code null} if out of bounds
161         */
162        private Regime getLinkedRegime() {
163            int index = linkedRegimeIndex < 0 ? chainedRegimes.size() + linkedRegimeIndex : linkedRegimeIndex;
164            return index < chainedRegimes.size() && index >= 0
165                    ? chainedRegimes.get(index)
166                    : null;
167        }
168
169        /**
170         * Forwards training to the linked regime if available; otherwise falls back
171         * to direct optimizer invocation (if non-null).
172         */
173        @Override
174        public <E extends TrainableFunction<N>, N extends Number> void train(E estimationFunction, DataSet<N> trainingSet, ObjectiveFunction<N> objective, Optimizer<? super E, N> optimizer) {
175            train(estimationFunction, trainingSet, objective, optimizer, (Integer) null);
176        }
177
178        @Override
179        public <E extends TrainableFunction<N>, N extends Number> void train(E estimationFunction, DataSet<N> trainingSet, ObjectiveFunction<N> objective, Optimizer<? super E, N> optimizer, int step) {
180            train(estimationFunction, trainingSet, objective, optimizer, (Integer) step);
181        }
182
183        private <E extends TrainableFunction<N>, N extends Number> void train(E estimationFunction, DataSet<N> trainingSet, ObjectiveFunction<N> objective, Optimizer<? super E, N> optimizer, Integer step) {
184            Regime linkedRegime = getLinkedRegime();
185            if (linkedRegime != null) {
186                if (step == null) {
187                    linkedRegime.train(estimationFunction, trainingSet, objective, optimizer);
188                } else {
189                    linkedRegime.train(estimationFunction, trainingSet, objective, optimizer, step);
190                }
191            } else {
192                if (optimizer != null) {
193                    if (step == null) {
194                        throw new IllegalStateException("No step specified, can't call optimizer!");
195                    } else {
196                        optimizer.optimize(estimationFunction, trainingSet, objective, step);
197                    }
198                }
199            }
200        }
201    }
202
203    /**
204     * Builder for constructing instances of {@link ChainedRegime}.
205     * <p>
206     * A chained regime allows multiple {@link Regime} strategies to be
207     * combined and executed in sequence. The {@code Builder} provides
208     * a fluent API to assemble the chain and produce an immutable
209     * {@code ChainedRegime} instance.
210     * </p>
211     */
212    @net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Builder
213    public static class Builder {
214
215        private final List<Regime> chainedRegimes = new ArrayList<>();
216        private Regime targetRegime = nextLink();
217
218        private Link nextLink() {
219            return new Link(chainedRegimes, -2 - chainedRegimes.size());
220        }
221
222        /**
223         * Adds the given regime to the chain and updates {@link #targetRegime}.
224         *
225         * @param regime the regime to add
226         * @return {@code this} builder
227         */
228        private Builder chainRegime(Regime regime) {
229            chainedRegimes.addFirst(regime);
230            targetRegime = nextLink();
231            return this;
232        }
233
234        /**
235         * Adds a {@link BatchRegime} decorator around the current target.
236         *
237         * @return this builder (for fluent chaining)
238         * @see BatchRegime
239         */
240        public final ChainedRegime batch() {
241            return chainRegime(new BatchRegime()).build();
242        }
243
244        /**
245         * Adds an {@link StochasticRegime} decorator around the current target.
246         *
247         * @return this builder (for fluent chaining)
248         * @see StochasticRegime
249         */
250        public final ChainedRegime stochastic() {
251            return chainRegime(new StochasticRegime()).build();
252        }
253
254        /**
255         * Adds a {@link MiniBatchRegime} decorator with a default batch size of 32.
256         *
257         * @return this builder (for fluent chaining)
258         * @see MiniBatchRegime
259         */
260        public final ChainedRegime miniBatch() {
261            return miniBatch(32);
262        }
263
264        /**
265         * Adds a {@link MiniBatchRegime} decorator with the given batch size.
266         *
267         * @param batchSize the number of samples per mini-batch (must be > 0)
268         * @return this builder (for fluent chaining)
269         * @see MiniBatchRegime
270         */
271        public final ChainedRegime miniBatch(int batchSize) {
272            return chainRegime(new MiniBatchRegime(batchSize)).build();
273        }
274
275        /**
276         * Adds an {@link EpochRegime} decorator with a default of 1,000 epochs.
277         *
278         * @return this builder (for fluent chaining)
279         * @see EpochRegime
280         */
281        public final Builder epochs() {
282            return epochs(1_000);
283        }
284
285        /**
286         * Adds an {@link EpochRegime} decorator with the given number of epochs.
287         *
288         * @param epochs the number of epochs to run (must be >= 1)
289         * @return this builder (for fluent chaining)
290         * @see EpochRegime
291         */
292        public final Builder epochs(int epochs) {
293            return chainRegime(new EpochRegime(targetRegime, epochs));
294        }
295
296        public final Builder epochs(int epochs, EpochRegime.EpochCompletionListener... listeners) {
297            EpochRegime epochRegime = new EpochRegime(targetRegime, epochs);
298            Arrays.stream(listeners).forEach(epochRegime::addEpochCompletionListener);
299            return chainRegime(epochRegime);
300        }
301
302        /**
303         * Adds an {@link ObjectiveReportingRegime} decorator that reports
304         * objective (loss) values with dumping enabled.
305         *
306         * @return this builder (for fluent chaining)
307         * @see ObjectiveReportingRegime
308         */
309        public final Builder reportObjective() {
310            return chainRegime(new ObjectiveReportingRegime(targetRegime, true));
311        }
312
313        /**
314         * Adds a {@link DumpNodesRegime} decorator with default options (dump after training).
315         *
316         * @return this builder (for fluent chaining)
317         * @see DumpNodesRegime
318         */
319        public final Builder dumpNodes() {
320            return dumpNodes(false);
321        }
322
323        /**
324         * Adds a {@link DumpNodesRegime} decorator with an initial dump toggle.
325         *
326         * @param firstTime whether to dump before the first training step
327         * @return this builder (for fluent chaining)
328         * @see DumpNodesRegime
329         */
330        public final Builder dumpNodes(boolean firstTime) {
331            return dumpNodes(firstTime, false);
332        }
333
334        /**
335         * Adds a {@link DumpNodesRegime} decorator with full configuration.
336         *
337         * @param firstTime     whether to dump before the first training step
338         * @param includeInputs whether to include input nodes in the dump
339         * @return this builder (for fluent chaining)
340         * @see DumpNodesRegime
341         */
342        public final Builder dumpNodes(boolean firstTime, boolean includeInputs) {
343            return chainRegime(new DumpNodesRegime(targetRegime, firstTime, includeInputs));
344        }
345
346        /**
347         * Finalizes the builder and creates an immutable {@link ChainedRegime}.
348         *
349         * <p>The returned {@link ChainedRegime} contains the current list of
350         * decorators in the order they were added. The underlying list is wrapped
351         * with {@link List#copyOf(java.util.Collection)} to ensure immutability,
352         * so further modifications to this builder will not affect the built chain.</p>
353         *
354         * @return an immutable {@link ChainedRegime} representing the current builder state
355         * @see ChainedRegime
356         */
357        protected final ChainedRegime build() {
358            List<Regime> copyChainedRegimes = new ArrayList<>(chainedRegimes);
359            for (Regime regime : chainedRegimes) {
360                if (regime instanceof Link link) {
361                    copyChainedRegimes.add(new Link(copyChainedRegimes, link.linkedRegimeIndex));
362                } else {
363                    copyChainedRegimes.add(regime);
364                }
365            }
366            return new ChainedRegime(copyChainedRegimes);
367        }
368    }
369
370}
